item.title: IP Command
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Why are you using accepting another socket?

You’re basically allowing another connection. There should already be a variable for each player’s IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: IP Command
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

Hey, I’m trying to make a command that gets a players IP Address. Here is what I have so fare and I’m getting an error.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("getip")) {
			String name = playerCommand.substring(6);
			for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
				if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null) {
					if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName
							.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
						java.net.Socket s = Server.clientListener.accept();
						s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
						String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
						playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
						c.sendMessage("Ip Address:" + connectingHost + ".");

Read full topic
